summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganHSA/FSA eligibleCeraVe AM Facial Moisturizing Lotion SPF 50 for Balanced to Oily Skin is a skincare multitasker that moisturizes throughout the day, helps absorb and reflect the sun's damaging UVA and UVB rays, helps restore the skin's protective barrier, and blends easily into most skin tones with no white cast.

reviews.headline: Made me breakout
reviews.comments: Feels heavy when applying and made my face breakout after one day.

reviews.headline: I wanted to like it :(
reviews.comments: I have the Cera Ve pm moisterizers and have loved those, so I wanted to try the ones with SPFâ€¦ I've found that it leaves a white cast on darker skin tones and the more you try to rub it in, the more it pills and comes off.

reviews.headline: Good
reviews.comments: I wanted a less expensive sunscreen compared to the face milk sunscreen from a different brand, and I think this is a good alternative. No complaints here!

reviews.headline: Caused a Reaction
reviews.comments: Offers great protection, no burns in direct sunlight for 2+ hours. However, it can feel heavy and has a strong sunscreen smell. I also have a reaction if I wear it for longer than an hour; the side of my nose becomes red, swollen and itchy and peels for a few days after use. It claims to use a micro-fine zinc, but I only have a reaction like this to certain chemical sunscreens. Need a more transparent description or ingredient list.

reviews.headline: Not black girl friendly
reviews.comments: Major white no matter how well you rub it in. Such a shame because the matte formula is good, so I thought this one would do well. Nope.

reviews.headline: False advertising
reviews.comments: Not well priced for what it is

reviews.headline: Meh
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this because I use the SPF 30 version and loved it but it leaves my skin very greasy and oily-feeling. Throughout the day, my skin looks very textured after wearing this. It feels alright on the skin but the appearance is not great.

reviews.headline: Perfect for dry skin. Love how it moisturizes!
reviews.comments: The product feels and smells like regular sunscreen when you first apply, however it absorbs well into the skin and definitely feels lightweight compared to other facial sunscreens I have used. Maybe would not recommend for oily skin type

reviews.headline: I like it.
reviews.comments: I like the pump on this, I feel more likely to put this on because of the dispenser. It does leave a bit of a white cast, but I like the feel on my skin so much that I don't care. If you rub it in well enought and let it sit the white cast isnt too noticeable. I love their PM moisturizer so maybe that has to do with it.

reviews.headline: Great moisurizer
reviews.comments: My skin has never looked so good. Light feeling with 50 SPF. This is my second bottle.

reviews.headline: Allergic?
reviews.comments: I've used the SPF 30 version with no issues. SPF 50 version makes me feel like my skin is burning.

reviews.headline: Gets the job done
reviews.comments:
It feels like traditional sunscreen initially, but I didn't notice it on my skin after it sunk in within the first hour or so. The bar was set too high with the Cerave ultralight lotion with SPF 30. I love that formula and packaging way more.

Unfortunately it pilled when I tried to use it after my daily serums. So I'll have to save it for days when I'm not using other skin care.

reviews.headline: Leaves a white cast if you're black
reviews.comments: I purchased this and do not like it because it leaves a very visible white cast that stays on for a very long time.

reviews.headline: Hard Time Absorbing
reviews.comments: Great price, but if you're looking for a facial SPF moisturizer that doesn't leave a white tint on your face, don't get this. It did protect my skin from the sun.

reviews.headline: Better than the 30SPF
reviews.comments: Cerave 50 is better than the 30. Moisturizing and doesn't dry like the 30. Pleasantly surprised

reviews.headline: Favorite sunscreen
reviews.comments: I am in my 40s and a licensed esthetician. I have tried so many sunscreens in my life and this one is my absolute favorite. It blends well, doesn't sting my eyes or bleed later in the day, doesn't feel heavy, adds a bit of moisture and does not irritate my super sensitive skin. I highly recommend this daily SPF.

reviews.headline: Surprising
reviews.comments: This is much more comfortable than the AM spf 30. This doesnt sting the eyes, and doesnt have the white cast that the spf 30 does. Moisturizing without feeling at all heavy. New favorite!!
